result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie K Klockow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.

Defendant shall have no contact with H.N.K.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
All conditions of probation in Count 1 are inclusive of Count 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie K Klockow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Ryan J. Hetzel.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State moves to amend to 2 Counts Class A Misdemeanor of Contributing to the Delinquency of a Minor-948.40(1), Court grants amendment.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1 and Count 2 as amended.  Defendant voluntarily decided not to have a preliminary examination.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and Count 2 as amended and enters judgment.

Def in person & by Atty Ryan J. Hetzel.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel request adjournment for additional pretrial for State to contact the victim and family.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety; No contact with HNK or HNK's family
Victims request to be present for sentencing hearing

Def in person & by Atty Ryan J. Hetzel.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State request $500.00 cash bond, counsel request a signature bond and defendant is in counseling.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond.   Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Initial appearance on May 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.
